title: City Renewable Energy Financing Assistance
description: Property-Assessed Clean Energy (PACE) is a state initiative that allows for a city government fund for individual property owners to borrow money for renewable energy investments.

title: Allow More Solar Arrays in the Historic District
description: New guidelines are needed to allow for solar arrays to be visible from primary street-fronts in our Historic District.

title: City Council Sustainable Practices Presentation
description: The Blue Ribbon Committee on Sustainable Practices is presenting the City Council with sustainable initiatives on November 17.

title: Use Reusable Shopping Bags
description: This holiday shopping season, don’t wait for the City Council to enact the single-use, carry-out, plastic shopping bag ordinance to act.

title: Pay-as-you-throw trash proposed in Portsmouth
description: An article on the Blue Ribbon Committee on Sustainable Practices Pay-as-you-throw initiative.

title: 2015 is a Promising Year for Sustainability
description: This New Year, let's make a conscious effort as individuals and as communities to make the seacoast sustainable.

title: Stop Wasting Waste with a Pease Wastewater Treatment Plant
description: Including an anaerobic digester at an expanded Pease wastewater treatment plant is cost-effective.

title: Gary's Green Deer Street Garage
description: Building Integrated Photovoltaic (BIPV) arrays should be visible on the Deer Street garage’s mixed-use, form-based code compliant liner from the street.

title: Plastic Bag Monsters
description: Enthusiasm grows for Portsmouth's single-use, carry-out plastic bag ordinance as it is now ready for a First Reading at City Council.

title: Sustainable Future Worth Risk
description: Portsmouth leading by enacting New Hampshire's first single-use, carry-out, plastic bag ordinance is a risk the City Council should take.

title: All Politics are Local
description: Enacting the single-use, carry-out, plastic bag ordinance will help educate the public on the collective harms of single-use plastic items.

title: Ahead of the Times
description: Unlike my 2013 Deer Street garage proposal, we do not have to wait until the single-use, carry-out, plastic bag ordinance is popular to act.

title: The Truth About Totes
description: The plastic bag ordinance allows plastic meat and vegetable bag use for the continued prevention of potentially harmful cross-contamination.

title: Portsmouth drops proposed plastic bag ban
description: An article on the City Council not voting on the single-use, carry-out, plastic shopping bag ordinance.

title: Missed Opportunity
description: The plastic bag ordinance's awareness campaign was a success, despite the City Council missing a leadership opportunity by not voting on it.

title: Up-cycle
description: In addition to reusing shopping bags, recycling, or composting, consider up-cycling unwanted products to make them anew again.

title: Portsmouth businesses asked to take plastic-bag free pledge
description: Campaign promotes shopping at stores that sign on

title: Take the plastic bag free Portsmouth pledge
description: The Plastic Bag Free Portsmouth Pledge encourages businesses to voluntarily stop issuing single-use plastic shopping bags.
